com.vectorprint.report.itext.style.stylers

Class SimpleColumns

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.vectorprint.configuration.parameters.ParameterizableImpl
      • com.vectorprint.report.itext.style.stylers.AbstractStyler
        • com.vectorprint.report.itext.style.stylers.AdvancedImpl<Object>
          • com.vectorprint.report.itext.style.stylers.SimpleColumns
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    com.itextpdf.text.pdf.PdfPCellEvent, com.itextpdf.text.pdf.PdfPTableEvent, com.vectorprint.configuration.parameters.Parameterizable, DocumentAware, ElementProducing, LayerManagerAware, BaseStyler, Advanced<Object>, Cloneable, Observer

    public class SimpleColumns
extends AdvancedImpl<Object>
implements ElementProducing
    Printing content (text, tables, lists and images) in rectangular columns of equal width with spacing between them. Calculates column dimensions based on some parameter values.
    Author:
    Eduard Drenth at VectorPrint.nl

      • prepareColumns

        protected com.itextpdf.text.pdf.ColumnText prepareColumns()
                                                   throws com.vectorprint.VectorPrintException
        calls AdvancedImpl.getPreparedCanvas() to create a new ColumnText.ColumnText(com.itextpdf.text.pdf.PdfContentByte) and calculates column Rectangles based on parameters.
        Returns:
        Throws:
        com.vectorprint.VectorPrintException

        public SimpleColumns write()
                    throws com.itextpdf.text.DocumentException
        Calls write(boolean) with true;
        Throws:
        com.itextpdf.text.DocumentException

      • write

        public SimpleColumns write(boolean last)
                    throws com.itextpdf.text.DocumentException
        writes out content taking into account the current vertical position in the document and making sure that the next call to Document.add(com.itextpdf.text.Element) will start at the correct vertical position.
        Parameters:
        last - when true space will be appended to start adding content at the correct position after the columns
        Throws:
        com.itextpdf.text.DocumentException
        See Also:
        getSpaceBefore(), getSpaceAfter()

      • getVerticalAdvance

        public float getVerticalAdvance()
        The maximum amount of space taken by any column on a page until now, calculated from PdfWriter.getVerticalPosition(boolean), taking into account getSpaceBefore() if needed. You can use this method after a series of addContent(java.lang.Object, java.lang.String...) and write(boolean) to know how much vertical spacing is needed before adding other content to the document.
        Returns:
        See Also:
        getSpaceAfter()

      • getSpaceAfter

        public float getSpaceAfter()
        Returns:
        the configured space after the columns

      • getSpaceBefore

        public float getSpaceBefore()
        Returns:
        the configured space before the columns

      • getColumns

      • addContent

        public SimpleColumns addContent(Object data,
                       String... styleClasses)
                         throws com.vectorprint.VectorPrintException,
                                com.itextpdf.text.DocumentException
        adds content to the columns and calls write(false) when WRITECOUNT is greater then zero and reached
        Parameters:
        data - Chunk, Phrase, Image, List, Paragraph, PdfPTable or String
        styleClasses - stylers to apply to added content, they will be appended to the stylers defined after the SimpleColumns styler (i.e. the Font in this definition: kols=SimpleColumns(columns=3,mode=composite,writecount=10,opacity=0.7);Font(style=italic))
        Returns:
        Throws:
        com.vectorprint.VectorPrintException
        com.itextpdf.text.DocumentException

      • willWriteAfterNextAdd

        public boolean willWriteAfterNextAdd()
        indicates whether the next call to addContent(java.lang.Object, java.lang.String...) will trigger a call to write(false) .
        Returns:
